channel.title: Electromagnetics on FalconBlog
channel.description: Recent content in Electromagnetics on FalconBlog

item.title: Day 30
item.description:
📅 June 30, 2025 – Monday

  • 📖 Studied Material Science for Electrical Engineers: Put in a solid 3+ hour session deeply focused on crystallography, semiconductors, and energy bands.
  • 📚 Borrowed Books from NIT Library: Picked up reference books for both Material Science and Engineering Electromagnetics to aid in exam preparation.
  • 🔌 More Electromagnetics Study: Dedicated additional 2+ hours reviewing concepts and solving problems related to transmission lines and waveguides.

Rounded off June with a focused academic push, ensuring both subjects are on track heading into the next phase.

item.title: Day 29
item.description:
📅 June 29, 2025 – Sunday

  • 📚 Studied Engineering Electromagnetics: Dedicated 2+ hours to revising key concepts. Focused particularly on Maxwell’s equations and wave propagation.
  • 🧠 Final Attempt at GCTF Challenges: Took one last shot at solving the remaining Google CTF questions. It was a mentally stimulating session.
  • 📝 Module Assignment Form: Created and circulated a Google Form to gather module preferences or updates from the team. It will help streamline project responsibilities moving forward.

A productive day of both academic and CTF-related progress, with a strong sense of closure as the month nears its end.
